Detailed Description

The data for a column.

This class stores the data for a column. Developers creating a table should use Column(string, db_types_t) because it will automatically track the column index for you. If you(the developer) are performing a query and want only a specific set of columns, use Column(string, db_types_t, int) where the last param is the index of the column you want.

Column::Column ( str  name,
db_types_t  type,
int  index 
)

Creates a new column with a name, type, and index.

Using this constructor means you have to keep track of the number of columns manually. Don't use it because it's a whole lot easier to use Column(str, db_types_t).

Parameters:
name The name of the column
type The type of the column
index The index of the column

int Column::get_index (  ) 

Get the index of the Column.

This is used to get this column's index. You won't need to use it. It's here for the Table and Database classes to use
